question: Who wrote, The Political Theory of Possessive Individualism: Hobbes to Locke?
explanation: In 1962, C.B. Macpherson wrote, The Political Theory of Possessive Individualism: Hobbes to Locke, in which he describe the main assumption underlying modern liberal theory and held that an individual is the sole proprietor of his own person or capacities for which he owes nothing to society.
